page.title: 09Kytes Pond - Kirtlington
page.content: Kytes Pond is almost certainly an "open pond". The ecology of the pond includes lots of rapidly growing lilies so it has to be cleared every year. There are also many birds. The Moorhens on the pond have produced at least one chick every year. Some years ago a Woodcock landed on a muddy beach on the pond. Some time after that the muddy beach was dug away, so it is unlikely to happen again. The House Martins used to build their nests using mud from the mud bank, but they have gone away since the mud bank was dug away. There are several Grey Wagtails near the pond. Lots of Chiff-Chaffs sing in the trees behind the pond. In 1977 when the pond was cleared out a Crucian Carp was found dead floating on the surface. Some people near the pond find newts on their doorsteps.
